column5: Hi everyone, I was hoping someone could message me a nice fishing lodge for my 2014 fishing holiday.  Preferably Northwest Ontario but not a necessity.  The lodge I was going to book does not have an opening so I am left to try and find a place.  I have read every post on here dating back a few years about Lodges and now I have a headache! I have fished in Quebec, Eastern Ontario, and Western Ontario over the last 15 years.  I have had some nightmarish experiences and want to try and avoid that. Any help would be greatly appreciated.  Mike
Pick out the ones you like here http://getnorth.com/  then post the ones you like to this thread and see what the community thinks about your choices.  Does that sound reasonable?
Yes that's reasonable.  I appreciate the help.
You looking for fly-in? Drive-in?  Specific fish you want to target? Time of year?  Number of people in your party?  The more info you provide, the better advice you'll get

I am traveling with 2 people, drive in or boat in, June 21 through July 5 (any days in between those dates) Smallmouth, Northern, Walleye, Musky would be great if they all swam near the cabin. I have flown to Toronto, then Thunder Bay, rent a car and drive North in the past.
Mike's recommendations will be rock solid...
http://www.ontariossunsetcountry.ca/accom.cfm  Take your pick,lots of places to fish here I would recommend Lac Suel,LOW,or Eagle LK
All of the responses have been helpful.  Thank you very much for taking the time to respond.
Where were you planning on going?  That might help with some suggestions.

I have been real happy with lodges in around the Dryden and Atikokan area. Browns Clear Water has several out post camps and boat rental options. June has been some of the best fishing so you my need to get going on reservations soon. Good luck.
You should check out Women River Camp in Ear Falls . We have been there a few times . Great camp.
Thanks for all of the suggestions! Appreciate the help very much
